hello: i have xubuntu and i can't listen music
In the terminal should install the codecs you need.
Hit Ctrl+T and a terminal should pop
It'll pop up with the command line with text saying "denis@<nameofcomp>:
Type in your password and then hit 'y' when prompted
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-resources is what you need to type. Or you can copy it and hit Ctrl+Shift+V to paste it
That should fix your problem with the songs though.
It's downloading the files needed to play those songs.
